Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts our social history at the beginning of the Showa period when the ideological rule of Imperial Japan collapsed. This film also communicates a savage energy that the Japanese people held in that age, through visual expression and the performance of diverse artistes.

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as "Hardcore" (1979) by Jim Sharman,, starring George C. Scott, with one monologue in particular being pruned and shortened. No wonder "Hardcore" has found less admirers than the original.
